intro: Duroia retrorsipila, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and northern South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for various bird species. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates. However, it can become invasive in certain regions, outcompeting native vegetation.
